ul.li: Cuero ISD is closed from Monday, March 23, 2020 til May 4, 2020

p.strong: Welcome to our instructional support site for learning at home. Your education and safety are important to us. Please contact your child's teacher if you have any questions. Links will be updated as needed.

Cuero ISD Food Service Change: April 6

span.p: Next week Monday April 6th will be the only food service day for the week of April 6-9 (Monday-Thursday). At Curbside and Bus Delivery spots, meals will be given out for the week for both breakfast and lunch. Curbside will still be 10-12 at Hunt and buses will follow the same schedule. Next meal service day will be Tuesday April 14th for the week of April 14-17 (Tuesday – Friday). Per TDA policies, meals cannot be provided for school holidays.

p.a: Please click here for the Current Bus Delivery Schedule

span.p: Please click here for a guide for meal storage and heating instructions.

a.title: Click to read more about: Cuero ISD Food Service Change: April 6

div.a: Read More about Cuero ISD Food Service Change: April 6

span.p: Dear Gobbler Family,
We will extend school closures through May the 4th.

Students need to continue to work online or through packets. Continue to access staff/teachers through the directory listed on the school website. We will put out future dates for packet submission or you may scan and submit to teacher via email. We will also put out dates/times for future packet pick-ups.
All extra-curricular/ co-curricular events are canceled while school is closed.
We will have meetings later this week and early next week to determine our next steps. Please be patient, more information to come soon.
God Bless and Be Safe.
For The Children,

Micah A. Dyer, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Cuero ISD

a.title: Click to read more about: Letter from the Superintendent: March 19, 2020

div.a: Read More about Letter from the Superintendent: March 19, 2020

span.strong: Cuero ISD is closed beginning Monday March 23rd. Please be patient with us as we continue to work out the logistics of this transition. More details will be available soon.

span.p: Dear Gobbler Family,
Thank you again for being patient with us as we gather information and make decisions.
Updates and clarifications:

*We are currently on Spring break. No students are at school. If they are there it is of their own choice. Using the track, playing ball with friends, etc. Schools are not open.
*Today is a big day in the decisionmaking process, we are going to get a lot of information on school closures and current emergency management procedures.
*I will be in meetings with state, regional, and local decisionmakers most of the day.
*We will explore the logistics of educating, feeding, and providing services for students and staff for the next several months.
*Friday is still the day we will release information/ plans regarding the next steps.
Once again thank you for your patience, we get new information hourly and I will try to answer questions as quickly as possible.
For the Children,

Micah A. Dyer, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Cuero ISD
March 13, 2020
Dear Gobbler Family,

UIL came out at 3:00 pm on Friday 3/13 and shut down all competitions from Monday 3/16 till Monday 3/30. Local practice is at the discretion of the local schools. CISD student athletes will need to contact their coaches in regards to practices over the next two weeks. No student will be punished for missing practice over concerns of health and wellness.

As of current we will be out for Spring Break from 3/13-3/22 returning to school on Monday the March 23rd.
If there are further closures or delays we will send communications out via all outlets.
Please be safe, cautious, and remain calm.
For the Children,

Micah A. Dyer, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Cuero ISD
The DAEP at Nixon-Smiley will be closed next week. Cuero ISD students that attend the DAEP in Nixon-Smiley do not need to attend next week. DAEP classes will resume on Monday, March 23, 2020.

Cuero ISD is aware that there is a HOAX going around that Cuero has received its first case of COVID-19 AKA Coronavirus. We have confirmed with local medical outlets that this is FALSE. As of 3/12/2020, we have not had any confirmed cases but are closely monitoring the situation.

CISD is taking every precaution to ensure the safety of our children and staff, including but not limited to extra sanitization efforts, reinforcing hygiene protocols for students and staff, and adding extra sanitization stations throughout the district. If and when CISD needs to take further action we will alert the public via every possible communication outlet. Please be precautious and take care. For further information and updates please go to https://www.cueroisd.org/Content2/1054

p.br:
Micah Dyer, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Cuero ISD
